alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island; Ocracoke Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 16 at 3:29PM EST until December 19 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM SUNDAY TO 4 PM EST MONDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM SUNDAY TO MIDNIGHT EST MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Warning, 2 to 4 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 10 to 20 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...Ocracoke Island and Hatteras Island. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Warning, from 8 AM Sunday to 4 PM EST Monday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 8 AM Sunday to midnight EST Monday night. * IMPACTS...Up to 2 to 4 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a low threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Minor to locally moderate ocean overwash possible which could affect travel on NC HWY 12 on Ocracoke Island and between Frisco and Hatteras Village. Some shoreline erosion will occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Initially flooding is expected on the oceanside Sunday, then likely transitioning to the soundside Sunday night and Monday as the winds shift with potential for rapid water level rises.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
